newsitem.title: USA: US Midwest direct hogs seen flat-up $0.50 -dealers.
newsitem.headline: US Midwest direct hogs seen flat-up $0.50 -dealers.

text.p: U.S. Midwest direct cash hogs Tuesday were seen steady to $0.50 per cwt higher amid continued firm packer demand that outstripped available hog supplies, livestock dealers said.
"We had a good run of hogs but there just were not enough," one Illinois hog dealer said.
Illinois top hog prices at plants were seen steady to $0.50 higher at $57.50 to $58.00.
Interior Iowa and southern Minnesota hog prices delivered to plants were seen steady, with a top of $58.50.
Indiana/Ohio top prices for hogs shipped to the plant could range from $58.25 to $58.75, sources there said.
Pork prices were seen holding firm on Tuesday, although the strength could stem more from light production than increased demand, several sources said.
Pork production for the week ended Saturday, Aug 2 was pegged at 295.7 million lbs, down 1.9 percent from the previous week, USDA statistics showed.
Hog slaughter Monday was light due to several plant holidays. Slaughter was estimated at 256,000 head, below 277,000 a week ago and 271,000 a year ago, USDA reported.
